title: Red Wine-Macerated Winter Fruit
directions: Remove zest from lemon with a vegetable peeler and squeeze juice from lemon. In a saucepan bring water to a boil with zest, lemon juice, wine, sugar, and cinnamon stick, stirring until sugar is dissolved. Simmer mixture 15 minutes.

While mixture is simmering, peel and core pineapple and cut into bite-size pieces. Halve figs if using. Pour hot syrup through a sieve into a bowl. Stir pineapple and dried fruit into syrup and cool. Chill fruit, covered, at least 8 hours and up to 2 days.
Serve fruit with mascarpone or crème fraîche and biscotti.
ingredients: 1 1/4 pounds mixed dried fruit such as prunes, apricots, figs, and cranberries
